oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Confederate soldier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this weathered tintype, the soldier appears to be holding a gun in both hands, cocked and pointed upward. He was likely one of three Teague brothers from Fayette County, Tenn. who served in the Confederate Army: either Pvt. Benjamin Franklin Teague, Co. E, 13th Tenn. Inf., CSA, Pvt. James Teague, Co. L, 2nd Partisan Rangers, Miss. Cav., CSA, or Pvt. Jeff Teague, Co. C, 20th Tenn. (Nixon's) Cav., CSA.
